left.title: Transcribe
left.text: Because Trancriptor runs in your browser, you can read and transcribe materials from anywhere.

middle.title: Share your opinion
middle.text: Users can discuss difficult writing or obscure words within a page to refine their transcription.

right.title: Explore
right.text: The resulting text is hosted on the web, making documents easy to read and search.

deed_type.xlat_rev: marked translation page as needing review

tips.title: Tips
lines: ZIP files may contain folders containing images, PDFs, or folders containing pdfs.
Each folder will be treated as a different document, so do not mix pages from different documents in the same folder.
Each PDF will be treated as its own document, so do not split pages from the same document among more than one PDF.

For example a ZIP file with 3 images, 2 PDFs, and 1 folder containing 5 more images would create 4 projects: the top level images in one, each PDF in their own project, and a last project containing the 5 images from the folder.
To specify metadata along with images, include a metadata.yml file in each folder specifying fields for the project.

validationMessages.noFileSelected: You must select a collection and select a file to upload!

label.transcriptionText: Transcribe the text of the marked line

message.markLineInPage: Mark the corresponding line to the highlighted text
message.noTextSelected: You must select text to add a mark!

placeholder.entitySearch: Search for an element to associate with your mark, Example: "San Martín" or "Middle Age"

newMark.title: Associate content to the mark
newMark.description: It is likely that someone has already uploaded the element you are looking to describe, you can search for it in this section and associate it with your mark. If you couldn't find what you're looking for, no problem! you can load the data of the new entity by clicking on the button "Create new Element"
newMark.emptyRelations: There are no relations to show

1.title: Choose the type of data
1.description: The data types will help you better define what you want to represent within the manuscript, use the search engine to find the one you need. There are a lot!

2.title: Load the data properties!
2.description: You have already selected the data type, each of these has associated several data properties that will help you to describe the specific characteristics of your element. From now on you can add and load the data properties that you consider most appropriate.

3.title: Load the Relationships
3.description: It is time to generate the associations of your element, these will allow you to generate a deeper description of its interaction with the real world. To load them, first you have to establish how they are related to your object through the "Add relationship" option, then it is only a matter of referencing another element already loaded or loading a new one indicating its properties.

4.title: Review and Save
4.description: Now check that the data is correct. If everything is fine, you can continue with the save.

page-versions.title: Versions
